result.execSummary:
The defendant BRIAN J. REILLY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.  Consecutive.  With good time. Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant currently in custody at the Calumet County Jail.

miscConds.notes:
Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.
Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Immediately following court, please report to:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Collections are done Monday - Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  You have 72 hours to make arrangements to complete collection.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. BRIAN J. REILLY

records.addlTxt: 10:49 AM  Defendant BRIAN J. REILLY in court, in custody, CALUMET COUNTY JAIL.  Attorney Ryan S Van Ells in court for BRIAN J. REILLY.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony Prekop in court for the State of Wisconsin.

No contact violent contact with V1  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Do not be on the premises of any bars or taverns.  Child visitation through 3rd party.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant BRIAN J. REILLY in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan S Van Ells in court for BRIAN J. REILLY.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant BRIAN J. REILLY in court VIA ZOOM with attorney Ryan S Van Ells.  Defendant BRIAN J. REILLY in custody WINNEBAGO COUNTY JAIL.  Amanda Nash appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  Victim by phone - requests no contact to be lifted.  Atty Van Ells to efile bond modification for court's review.  Plea entered - bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
